Package src.components

Class Grid

java.lang.Object
src.components.Grid
public class Grid extends Object
The Grid Class is intended to set the structure for the Fields. It provides functionalities to create Fields and place them in a Matrix and to keep references to the surrounding Fields. First a value matrix is generated. Then Mines will be set per random inside the Grid. After that, the values around the mines are calculated. At the end, for every value in the value matrix, a Field will be added to the fieldMatrix.

  • Constructor Details

    • Grid

      public Grid(int width, int height, int mineCount)
      Takes width, height and a mine count to create a Grid Object. Creates a value and Field matrix, sets mines and values, creates Fields and creates references to the surrounding Fields.
      Parameters:
      width - width of the Grid
      height - height of the Grid
      mineCount - amount of mines in the Grid

  • Method Details

    • getValue

      public int getValue(int x, int y)
      Returns a value from the value matrix.
      Parameters:
      x - x location in the value matrix
      y - y location in the value matrix
      Returns:
      value of position xy in the value matrix

      public Point getSize()
      Returns a Point Object representing width and height of the value matrix as x and y.
      Returns:
      size of the value matrix as x and y

      public Field getField(int x, int y)
      Takes x and y coordinates to get the Field at location xy of the field matrix.
      Parameters:
      x - location x in the Field matrix
      y - location y in the Field matrix
      Returns:
